title: 109_hr3944
content: The "Small Business Fuel Cost Relief Act of 2005" provides a temporary credit against income tax for small businesses, farmers, and fishermen to offset high fuel costs. This Act is cited as the SEC. 45N. Temporary Credit for Small Businesses, Farmers, and Fishermen to Offset High Fuel Costs. The "Small Business Fuel Cost Relief Act of 2005" offers a credit for excessive fuel costs incurred by eligible taxpayers in their trade or business activities. Excessive fuel cost is the difference between the amount paid for creditable fuel and the adjusted base price determined by the Secretary. The "Small Business Fuel Cost Relief Act of 2005" provides a credit for excessive fuel costs incurred by eligible taxpayers. The applicable Labor Day 2004 price for fuel is determined by the Secretary and adjusted for inflation using data from the Energy Information Agency. The inflation adjustment is based on the monthly Consumer Price Index to reflect current inflation more accurately. Eligible taxpayers are defined for the purposes of this section. The "Small Business Fuel Cost Relief Act of 2005" provides a credit for excessive fuel costs incurred by eligible taxpayers engaged in farming, commercial fishing, or small businesses meeting specific gross receipts criteria. The "Small Business Fuel Cost Relief Act of 2005" offers a credit for eligible taxpayers in farming, commercial fishing, or small businesses for specific fuel purchases like gasoline, diesel fuel, heating oil, and natural gas. Taxpayers can choose a standard mileage allowance of 60 cents per mile instead of the credit. The credit applies to fuels bought within a 2-year period from the enactment date. The amendment to section 38 of the tax code allows eligible taxpayers to claim the excessive fuel cost credit under section 45N(a). A clerical amendment is made to the table of sections for subpart D of part IV of the tax code. The amendment allows small businesses, farmers, and fishermen to claim a temporary credit to offset high fuel costs. Effective for taxable years ending after the enactment of the Act.
